create.title: Create Token Factories
create.description: Deploy factory contracts for your selected asset types

error.system-not-found: System address not found. Please ensure a system is deployed first.
error.system-not-bootstrapped: System needs to be bootstrapped first. Please wait for system initialization to complete.
error.no-result: Factory deployment completed but no address was returned

bond.title: A digital fixed-income security asset
bond.description: A bond is a debt instrument through which an issuer raises capital from investors, agreeing to repay the principal with interest over a defined period. When issued on blockchain, bonds become programmable assets with transparent terms, automated compliance, and efficient end-to-end lifecycle management from issuance to settlement.

deposit.title: Secure and compliant digital deposit management
deposit.description: A deposit is the act of placing funds into a financial account, typically for safekeeping, future use, or to fulfill a contractual obligation. On blockchain platforms, deposits can be represented as digital tokens, enabling automated verification, conditional release, and auditable custody throughout the transaction lifecycle.

equity.title: Institutional-grade digital equity management
equity.description: Equity refers to the ownership interest in a company or asset, typically entitling the holder to a share of profits and voting rights. When tokenized on blockchain, equity can be issued, managed, and transferred with programmable rules, improving access, liquidity, and operational efficiency in ownership markets.

fund.title: Digital asset for institutional fund management
fund.description: A fund aggregates capital from multiple investors to invest in a portfolio of assets according to a defined strategy and management structure. Tokenizing funds on blockchain enables granular ownership tracking, efficient distribution of returns, and streamlined operations through smart contracts and real-time reporting.

stablecoin.title: A secure and collateralized digital currency
stablecoin.description: A stablecoin is a type of cryptocurrency engineered to maintain a stable value, often backed by reserves like fiat currencies or other assets. On blockchain platforms, stablecoins provide a dependable medium of exchange and store of value, facilitating seamless, low-volatility transactions and programmable financial operations.

box1.title: Getting Started with Bond Creation
box1.description: Learn how to create and deploy tokenized bonds with customizable maturity dates, interest rates, and compliance rules tailored for institutional investors.

box2.title: Bond Compliance and Regulatory Framework
box2.description: Understand the regulatory requirements for tokenized bonds, including investor eligibility, transfer restrictions, and automated coupon payment mechanisms.

box3.title: Bond Contract Architecture
box3.description: Explore the technical implementation of bond tokens including face value calculations, yield management, and integration with payment systems for automated settlements.

box1.title: Getting Started with Deposit Token Creation
box1.description: Learn how to tokenize deposits with configurable withdrawal conditions, interest accrual, and multi-signature approval workflows.

box2.title: Deposit Compliance and Security Standards
box2.description: Understand the security measures and compliance features for tokenized deposits, including custody controls and audit trail requirements.

box3.title: Deposit Contract Architecture
box3.description: Explore the technical design of deposit tokens including time-lock mechanisms, conditional release logic, and integration with custody providers.

box1.title: Getting Started with Equity Token Creation
box1.description: Learn how to tokenize company shares with voting rights, dividend distribution capabilities, and cap table management features.

box2.title: Equity Compliance and Shareholder Rights
box2.description: Understand the regulatory framework for tokenized equity, including shareholder agreements, voting mechanisms, and transfer restrictions.

box3.title: Equity Contract Architecture
box3.description: Explore the implementation of equity tokens including governance features, dividend distribution systems, and corporate action handling.

box1.title: Getting Started with Fund Token Creation
box1.description: Learn how to create tokenized investment funds with NAV calculations, subscription/redemption workflows, and performance fee structures.

box2.title: Fund Compliance and Investor Protection
box2.description: Understand the regulatory requirements for tokenized funds, including investor accreditation, lock-up periods, and reporting obligations.

box3.title: Fund Contract Architecture
box3.description: Explore the technical design of fund tokens including portfolio management, fee calculations, and integration with fund administration systems.

box1.title: Getting Started with Stablecoin Creation
box1.description: Learn how to deploy stablecoins with configurable collateral requirements, minting/burning controls, and price stability mechanisms.

box2.title: Stablecoin Compliance and Reserve Management
box2.description: Understand the regulatory framework for stablecoins, including reserve auditing, redemption guarantees, and anti-money laundering controls.

box3.title: Stablecoin Contract Architecture
box3.description: Explore the implementation of stablecoins including oracle integrations, collateral management, and automated rebalancing mechanisms.
